todos.title: Technologies
todos.body: Hadoop for massive data analysis, memcached for distributed caching, and twisted for event driven programming.

todos.title: Bait and Switch
todos.body: Customers usually don’t mind a bait and switch if you switch them to something that is more valuable.
Aim to be healthy 80% of the time.

todos.title: Measuring User Behavior
todos.body: Acquisition – what channels are users coming from, Activation – are users happy with first experience, Retention – are users coming back, Referral – are users telling other users, Revenue- are users spending money.

todos.title: Hiring
todos.body: A players hire A players while B players hire C players.

todos.title: Just Data
todos.body: You will get a lot of conflicting advice as a startup.  Remember its all just data.  Some recommendations will apply to you and some you should ignore.  Conflicting advice is not bad thing because it teaches you how to weed through everything and make a smart decision.  Try to collect as much data and differing views as possible.

todos.title: Show, don’t tell
todos.body: Visuals, graphics, videos.

todos.title: Outsource
todos.body: Things that are not crucial to your business.  Only outsource to things that are a proven scalable leader.

todos.title: Fake Angels
todos.body: They are there for the gig-flow, not to make investments.  Ask the investor how long they have been making angel investments and how many they have made.

todos.title: People
todos.body: The three most important things in entrepreneurship are people, people, people.

todos.title: Happy Ears
todos.body: The tendency to hear what one wants to hear.

todos.title: Switch & Pivot
todos.body: The most successful startups started doing something else.  Success is through hundreds of small and sometimes large adjustments.

todos.title: Execution Machines
todos.body: The greatest entrepreneurs grind and get it done.

todos.title: Gretsky
todos.body: Skate to where the puck is going.

todos.title: Two strikes
todos.body: Screw me once and I will confront you and forgive, screw me twice and we’re done.

todos.title: Entrepreneur characteristics
todos.body: passion, determination, raw intelligence, agility, resourcefulness, clarity, focus, empathy, leadership, smarter and harder, team dynamics.

todos.title: Feature Creep
todos.body: New features to a product can actually bring less users.

todos.title: Quick Baby Steps
todos.body: Move fast in small leaps so that you are building a good foundation underneath you.

todos.title: C-Corp
todos.body: Most preferential organizational structure to angels and VCs because of deferred revenue and UBTI (unrelated business tax income).  Default to Delaware.

todos.title: Everythingitis
todos.body: Most people use a service because it does one thing really well.  Don’t have too many features.

todos.title: Failure
todos.body: Is likely of every venture but with each new iteration you give yourself a better chance.

todos.title: Use Your Head Then Gut
todos.body: Intelligence is the ability to hold contradictory ideas in your head at the same time.

todos.title: Raising Money
todos.body: If you want money, ask for advice.  What someone helps write, they will help underwrite.  Raise the first one-third and the rest will come.

todos.title: Too Late
todos.body: If you aren’t releasing your crappy bug laden product, you are too late.

todos.title: Agility
todos.body: Have the perspective that things will rarely go as planned.

todos.title: Relationships
todos.body: Go for the relationship not the sale.  Startups screw up a lot and the relationship is what holds.

todos.title: Pain
todos.body: Focus on the pain before you talk about your solution.

todos.title: Worthless Idea
todos.body: Every idea is worthless.  Only through execution can you make something happen.  Overvaluing an idea is a red flag.  One can steal ideas but no one can steal execution or passion.

todos.title: Stay Healthy
todos.body: Don’t work seven days a week, get away (quarterly vacations), be present, meditate, yoga.

todos.title: Prototype
todos.body: Don’t plan, prototype.

todos.title: Co-Founder
todos.body: Don’t go at it alone.  Don’t have more than one non-technical founder in a tech company.

todos.title: Product/Sales
todos.body: Don’t build sales process too early.  Make sure you have a strong process.

todos.title: Ship early
todos.body: Don’t be ashamed of getting version 1.0 out on the market and iterating on it.

todos.title: Issues
todos.body: Discuss issues quickly with the goal of reaching consensus.

todos.title: Random Days
todos.body: Days where you will meet with anyone to talk about anything for 15 minutes.  Spurs ideas and creativity.

todos.title: Monitor Users
todos.body: Carefully study what users are doing by monitoring their logs and studying analytics.  You are stupid, listen to your users or you will have none.

todos.title: Raising Money
todos.body: Bootstrapping, friends, family, church, investomers, partners, grants, angels.  Raising money helps you go faster.  Getting it right takes time and if you don’t have a ton of competitors in the same field don’t be afraid to take your time.

todos.title: Stuck on Idea
todos.body: Be so stuck on your idea that you can’t quit.

todos.title: 83(b)
todos.body: Allows you to pay taxes on stock ahead of time regardless to vesting so that you don’t have to pay taxes at a much higher value.

todos.title: Don’t Suck at E-mail
todos.body: 1. Respond quickly, even if you are letting them know you will get back to them, 2. Zero inbox, 3. use company e-mail, 4. Keep it to three sentences, 5. Be persistent.

todos.title: Great startup culture
todos.body: 1. Ideas rule, not politics or person, 2. it’s a mission, not a job, 3. Don’t tolerate mediocrity, 4. By frugal and scrappy, 5. Equity and incentive driven, 6. Good communication in bad times, 7. Take care of your needs, 8. Customer-obsessed, 9. Fun.
